meanings.definition: To remove the limber or limbers from (a gun).
meanings.sent1: The soldiers unlimbered the cannon before the battle.
meanings.sent2: The artillery crew unlimbered the guns to set up for firing.
meanings.sent3: The gun refused to be unlimbered, causing a comical delay in the military operation.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the old war veteran unlimbered memories of his days on the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the cannon being unlimbered echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: To prepare for action or use.
meanings.sent1: The chef unlimbered his knives before starting to cook.
meanings.sent2: Before the performance, the actors unlimbered their voices with vocal warm-ups.
meanings.sent3: The students unlimbered their pencils, ready to tackle the challenging test.
meanings.sent4: She unlimbered her wit during the debate, surprising everyone with her sharp remarks.
meanings.sent5: The athlete unlimbered his muscles before the race, ensuring they were ready for the sprint.
